Preparations for #19748

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [cce0699340](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19749/commits/cce06993407b47a1cc149d4f84e9755709b78b92)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Basis.Exact` (new file)|945|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Basis.ofSplitExact`
`+ Cotangent.mk_eq_zero_iff`
`+ LinearIndependent.linearIndependent_of_exact_of_retraction`
`+ Matrix.linearIndependent_cols_of_isUnit`
`+ Matrix.linearIndependent_rows_of_isUnit`
`+ Submodule.top_le_span_of_exact_of_retraction`
`+ aevalDifferential`
`+ aevalDifferentialEquiv`
`+ aevalDifferentialEquiv_apply`
`+ aevalDifferential_single`
`+ aevalDifferential_toMatrix'_eq_mapMatrix_jacobiMatrix`
`+ basisDeriv`
`+ basisDeriv_apply`
`+ linearIndependent_aeval_val_pderiv_relation`
`+ mulVec_injective_of_isUnit`
`+ prod_sum_eq_prod_toLeft_mul_prod_toRight`
`+ relation_mem_ker`
`+ subsingleton_of_rank_zero`
`+ vecMul_injective_of_isUnit`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thanks!

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12693561942/job/35381419667)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12693561942/job/35381420135)

Aside from the comment this looks good to me.

For the record I have tried to improve the defeq of the basis via `Finsupp.lmapDomain` etc but couldn't make it work. It is probably not that important anyways.

Aside from the comment this looks good to me.

For the record I have tried to improve the defeq of the basis via `Finsupp.lmapDomain` etc but couldn't make it work. It is probably not that important anyways.
This should be added near `rank_zero_iff` instead.
I thought that lemma would imply this one and I was wrong. I think the original place is better. Sorry for the back and forth.
I feel like `Codisjoint (Set.range a) (Set.range b)` will be easier to prove rather than `hab`.

```suggestion
For convenience this is stated for an arbitrary type `Î¹` with two maps `Îº â†’ Î¹` and `Ïƒ â†’ Î¹`. -/
```

```suggestion
# Basis from a split exact sequence
```

```suggestion
/-- Let `0 â†’ K â†’ M â†’ P â†’ 0` be a split exact sequence of `R`-modules, let `s : M â†’ K` be a
```

```suggestion
Let `0 â†’ K â†’ M â†’ P â†’ 0` be a split exact sequence of `R`-modules, let `s : M â†’ K` be a
```
Why is this necessary now?
Because there was an evil `open Classical` at the beginning of the file.
